Course Description: THIS COURSE INTRODUCES THE STUDENT TO FUNDAMENTAL CONCEPTS OF AUDITING AND EXPLAINS THE VARIOUS STAGES OF THE AUDIT PROCESS. THE COURSE FAMILIARIZES THE STUDENT WITH SUCH CONCEPTS AS AUDIT STANDARDS AND AUDITOR RESPONSIBILITIES, AUDIT RISK, MATERIALITY, AND AUDIT EVIDENCE. HOW TO AUDIT SPECIFIC BUSINESS CYCLES AND ACCOUNTS ARE IDENTIFIES AND HOW TO PREPARE AUDIT REPORTS ARE COVERED.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
AT THE END OF THE COURSE, THE STUDENT WILL:
(1) DEFINE KEY CONCEPTS AND TERMS OF THE AUDIT PROCESS.
(2) IDENTIFY PROFESSIONAL STANDARDS AND ETHICAL RESPONSIBILITIES FOR AN AUDITOR.
(3) APPLY AUDIT RISK TO COLLECTING AND DOCUMENTING AUDIT EVIDENCE.
(4) DEMONSTRATE SKILLS NEEDED TO AUDIT A COMPANY'S BUSINESS PROCESSES.
(5) EXPLAIN PROCEDURES TO OBTAIN AUDIT EVIDENCE.
(6) INTEGRATE AUDIT EVIDENCE INTO A FINAL AUDIT REPORT.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
